comments:
Stanley,
As discussed, please provide the JUnit testcases for the GLA editor and the Log 
Interactions view.
This is target for AC3.0 iteration 1 May 5th

First, my apologies. My memory of these JUnit tests have started to fade (it's 
been a while since I've touched them).

After additional discussions with Eugene:

- As discussed, there are already numerous tests in the logtrace plug-in that 
test the GLA components, including the GLA editor.

- There is already a check that involves the "variants" of the UML2SD view (I 
noticed this only after re-familiarizing myself with the code - my fault). 
Specifically, the Log Interactions view and Log Thread Interactions view are 
opened (one after another) after a correlation is created for a set of log 
files (this is done in the NewLogCorrelationTest.java test file).

As per our discussions, I am marking this bug as resolved - INVALID for the 
time being. As agreed, Eugene (or others) are more than welcome to re-open this 
bug if gaps in the logtrace automated testing are found.

Please let me know if you disagree - thanks.
porting to m9 driver is required

Just for the record, the following was found (and fixed in the patch) when 
attempting to run these testcases on the Eclipse M9 driver...
- fixed missing org.eclipse.debug.core dependency
- made changes to the GLA wizard test case: it now closes the editor after 
opening it, and fixes the data that's entered into the template log file entry
- updated the constant for the UML2SD views, and replaced ll uses of this ID to 
this constant

Also, bugs 58676 and 58667 were discovered (and subsequently fixed) in Hyades 
as a result of running these test cases.

I will push this to resolved - fixed once it's been confirmed that no more 
changes need to be made in order to run these test cases on M9.

tried with 3.0_20040416_1005 build and test cases are failed at 
1.testJSR047LoggingExampleWizard, and 
2.testLogCorrelatorSampleWizard.

(2) is possibly due to change of API in ILogRecordCorrelationEngine.correlate()

These two exceptions were intentionally thrown by the JUnit test cases to 
indicate failures in the JUnit tests. 

These failures are the result of problems detected in the imported projects, 
and *not* due to bugs in the JUnit tests. =)

Defects have been opened for these two bugs:
- bugzilla 58852 for the JSR-047 sample problems.
- bugzilla 58853 for the Log Correlator Sample problems.

I just ran the JUnit test cases against the Hyades 3.0 20040423_1355 driver, 
and everything passed... =)

As a result, I'm going to assume that the porting to M9 is complete, and 
marking this defect as Resolved - Fixed.

Please let me know if this is a problem - thanks.

bugzilla defect if it happens to be problem on the sample itself.

THANKS

Hi...

This exception was thrown because of problems detected in the sample project. 
Confirmed by manually going through the Hyades Apache Commons Sample wizard. No 
changes/fixes are required for JUnit testcases.

A separate bug has been opened to address the sample problem: bugzilla 60092. I 
will keep this bug open in the meantime until 60092 has been fixed & verified.

Please let me know if you disagree - Thanks. =)

I re-ran the JUnit testcases on the Hyades 3.0 20040428_0843 driver, and all 
testcases passed.

Pushing this to Resolved - FIXED.

Thanks.
